Articles.Content:
Aside from the stuff designed for planes I don't use because I play this game because of the rockets, I don't remember I've ever used hydraulic detachment manifold.

The thing is heavy and I see no real use for it.

What's your least used part and why?
I believe mine would be the 1m to .625m flat adapter, just because my stuff is generally much larger than that.
These three parts.
Hmmm, I am not sure... probably the small adapter.

These three parts.

Exactly them.
This piece of junk

Using the detachment manifold instead of the normal radial decouplers often fixed problems I had with boosters colliding with the main rocket after staging.

The large radial engine is useful for landers because of its low mass and its placement which works good with most lander designs.

I am not using any rocket nose caps anymore since I found out how the game calculates drag.

Using the detachment manifold instead of the normal radial decouplers often fixed problems I had with boosters colliding with the main rocket after staging.

That's what I've been doing lately. The bigger one is too big for realistic designs.

I am not using any rocket nose caps anymore since I found out how the game calculates drag.

I still use nosecones, but not the stock ones. They're old and look kinda ugly. Modded ones are the way to go.
I sometimes use those pieces of junk for shuttles, rarely though. I never use that big explosive radial decoupler. It just doesn't fit for anything.
The Not-Rockomax node and the thin girders.
Ooh I forgot about that one. I don't think I've used the Not-Rockomax node once.

I am not using any rocket nose caps anymore since I found out how the game calculates drag.

From the 0.22 changelog:

Nose Cones now actually help with improving stability during atmospheric flight.

So I've been using them in 0.22. Before that they were worse than useless, I agree.
I don't think I have ever used the 2.5 blue parachute, only the drogue. I can't see any reason to use that blue one.
Most likely, it would be the super large decoupler "which slices the largest of rockets in twain." I've always managed with the Rockomax Brand decoupler.

these 2 solar arrays.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/SP-W_2x3_Photovoltaic_Panels

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/SP-L_1x6_Photovoltaic_Panels

Why would I ever use these heavy things over the lighter versions?
For some reason I do, but I think it is just for the aesthetics.

For some reason I do, but I think it is just for the aesthetics.

Me too actually. I should probably use the lighter ones, but meh.
I don't remember to use this: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Small_Hardpoint
Solid rocket boosters. Because I can't shut them off if things go bad.
That ugly winglet-thing. Unfortunately, I was forced to use it since it's the first wing you unlock in career.

Struts.

...

BAHAHAHA. Sorry, couldn't keep a straight face for long enough.

The good news is that the parts are super easy to edit. So if you find that you can't use a part because it's inferior to other parts in every way (like that radial-mount engine), you can just tweak it so that it's not. For example, make that radial mount engine weigh less, and suddenly it's not useless.

I don't remember to use this: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Small_Hardpoint

Same with me, I didn't even know that part existed till a few days ago....

This piece of junk

Thats funny, because that is quickly becoming my second most used VTOL engine for my SVO line of ships.

Solid rocket boosters. Because I can't shut them off if things go bad.

But thats the most fun!
